document.title: SP488-B-Being Understanding

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: Being understanding with our children can result in less conflict in our relationships with them. Being understanding is also an important part of helping our children become secure and healthy people. And being understanding is a powerful way of showing love. Most of us feel that we are already good at understanding our children and at showing that understanding. But there are surprises in the process of understanding.
